intro: Stemonoporus gilimalensis, commonly known as the Gilima lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its elegant, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink blossoms. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
